Package hu.bme.mit.theta.frontend.transformation.model.statements

Class CStatement

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.bme.mit.theta.frontend.transformation.model.statements.CStatement
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CAssignment, CAssume, CBreak, CCall, CCase, CCompound, CContinue, CDecls, CDefault, CDoWhile, CExpr, CFor, CFunction, CGoto, CIf, CInitializerList, CProgram, CRet, CSwitch, CWhile
    public abstract class CStatement
extends java.lang.Object
    Every Program, Function and Statement is a subclass of this base class. Any CStatement might have an id associated with it, in case there was a label in the source code. This also provides an XcfaLocation, which can be used when jumping to this named location via a _goto_ instruction

      • getId

      • getExpression

        public Expr<?> getExpression()
        Returns the expression associated with a CStatement, which by default throws an exception, as not all subtypes will return one. For example, the C language statement `int a = (b = 0, 2)` will create a CCompound statement as the right-hand side of the assignment, whose associated expression will be 2, but the assignment to b has to come beforehand.
        Returns:
        The expression associated with the statement.
